results.definition: actually being performed at the time of hearing or viewing
examples: a live television program
brought to you live from Lincoln Center
live entertainment involves performers actually in the physical presence of a live audience
My grandfather lived until the end of war
a live volcano
the volcano is very much alive
the happiest person alive
the nerve is alive
doctors are working hard to keep him alive
burned alive
a live canary
a lively tennis ball

results.definition: be an inhabitant of or reside in
examples: People lived in Africa millions of years ago
Can you live on $2000 a month in New York City?

results.definition: continue to live and avoid dying
examples: The race car driver lived through several very serious accidents
One crash victim died, the other lived
a live wire

results.definition: have firsthand knowledge of states, situations, emotions, or sensations
examples: I have lived a kind of hell when I was a drug addict
The holocaust survivors have lived a nightmare
I lived through two divorces
the club members are a really live bunch
live ammunition
a live bomb
live coals
tossed a live cigarette out the window
got a shock from a live wire
live ore is unmined ore
a live bomb
a live ball is one in play
a live concert hall

results.definition: in current use or ready for use
examples: live copy is ready to be set in type or already set but not yet proofread

results.definition: lead a certain kind of life; live in a certain style
examples: we had to live frugally after the war
a live issue
still a live option

results.definition: pursue a positive and satisfying existence
examples: You must accept yourself and others if you really want to live
